snippet: Big college basketball games may be decided at the foul line over the next three weeks. Nobody on the planet shoots free throws as well, or as fast, as Bob Fisher.
abstract: Bob Fisher, soil conservation technician and failed high school basketball coach in Centralia, Kan, has set 14 Guinness world records in the past 26 months for basketball free-throw shooting; practicing on a free-throw-shooting device he created in his basement, Fisher has made 33 shoots in 30 seconds; National Basketball Assn players, granted 10 seconds to shoot each free throw, make about 75 percent.
lead_paragraph: Big college basketball games may be decided at the foul line over the next three weeks. Nobody on the planet shoots free throws as well, or as fast, as Bob Fisher.

headline.seo: Free-Throw Records Fall With the Flick of His Wrists
headline.main: No Dribbling and No Passing, but Free Throws Are Nonstop
headline.print_headline: No Dribbling and No Passing, But Free Throws Are Nonstop
